para.text: Table 8. Data Sets required by MODFLOW

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:2px; cell-spacing:2px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:1px; border-spacing:2px; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:raised-color; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.text: Specifies whether a cell is active or not.
Initial head used in the model
When the LPF, BCF6, or UPW package is active and no HK parameters are defined

The ratio of hydraulic conductivity along columns to hydraulic conductivity along rows, where Kx is the hydraulic conductivity along rows. Thus, the hydraulic conductivity along columns is the product of the values in Kx and Horizontal_Anisotropy.
When the LPF or UPW package is active, no HANI parameters are defined.
The vertical hydraulic conductivity. The default formula for Confining_Bed_Kz refers to Kz so that all vertical hydraulic conductivities can be set through Kz.
When the LPF, BCF6, or UPW package is active and no VK or VANI parameters are defined and the
para.link: Method of specifying vertical hydraulic conductivity

para.text: The vertical hydraulic conductivity of a Quasi-three-dimensional confining bed.
When the LPF, BCF6, or UPW package is active and no VKCB parameters are defined and there is at least one
The ratio of horizontal to vertical hydraulic conductivity
When the LPF or UPW package is active and no VK or VANI parameters are defined and the
para.link: Method of specifying vertical hydraulic conductivity
para.text: is the ratio of horizontal to vertical hydraulic conductivity.
When the LPF, BCF6, or UPW package is active and the model contains at least one transient stress period.
When the LPF, BCF6, or UPW package is active, the model contains at least one transient stress period and there is at least one convertible layer and no specific yield parameters are defined.
The wetting threshold. It is used in the formula for WetDry.
A flag to indicate which neighboring cells can cause a cell to become wet. It is used in the formula for WetDry.
The Wet_Dry_Flag data set is restricted to values between -1 and 1.
A combination of the wetting threshold and a flag to indicate which neighboring cells can cause a cell to become wet.
When the LPF or BCF6 package is active, the
for at least one layer is convertible, and
The confined storage coefficient is the specific storage times the layer thickness
When the BCF6 package is active, the model has at least one transient stress period, and a Confined or a Limited convertible layer is present.
The transmissivity is the horizontal hydraulic conductivity times the layer thickness.
When a Confined or a Limited convertible layer is present.
The vertical conductance is the vertical hydraulic conductivity divided by the thickness from the center of one layer to the center of the underlying layer. See page 5-7 of the
Used in all but the bottom layer.
The model layer to which the reservoir is connected.
When the Reservoir package is used and the user chooses a
When the Reservoir package is used.
Vertical hydraulic conductivity of the reservoir bed for all reservoirs
When the Reservoir package is used.
Thickness of reservoir-bed sediments for all reservoirs
When the Reservoir package is used.
The identification number of the lake occupying the grid cell
When the Lake package is used.
The lakebed leakance that will be assigned to lake/aquifer interfaces that occur in the corresponding grid cell. Note lakebed leakance is used
When the Lake package is used.
The elevation of the land surface.
When either the Unsaturated-Zone Flow package or the Farm Process is used.
Used to define the aerial extent of the active model in which recharge and discharge will be simulated.

A value of 0 indicates recharge and discharge will not be simulated. If NUZTOP ≥ 2, the value of IUZFBND indicates the layer whose top is the land surface. If NUZTOP = 2, the value of IUZFBND indicates the layer where recharge and discharge occurs.
When the Unsaturated-Zone Flow package is used.

Used to define the stream segments within the Streamflow-Routing (SFR2) Package or lake numbers in the Lake (LAK3) Package that overland runoff from excess infiltration and groundwater discharge to land surface will be added. A positive integer value identifies the stream segment and a negative integer value identifies the lake number.
When the Unsaturated-Zone Flow package is used and
para.link: discharge is routed to streams and lakes
para.text: and either the Lake or Streamflow Routing package is active.
The saturated vertical hydraulic conductivity of the unsaturated zone (L/t).
When the Unsaturated-Zone Flow package is used and
para.link: the user chooses to specify vertical hydraulic conductivity in the unsaturated zone separately from that in the saturated zone

para.text: The Brooks-Corey epsilon of the unsaturated zone. Epsilon is used in the relation of water content to hydraulic conductivity (Brooks and Corey, 1966).
When the Unsaturated-Zone Flow package is used.
The saturated water content of the unsaturated zone in units of volume of water to total volume (L

the elevation of the reference surface to be used to calculate the depth
When the HUF package is selected and one or more KDEP parameters is defined and the user

para.text: This data set is used to display the value of the hydraulic conductivity in the X direction that would be calculated by the HUF package.
This data set is used to display the value of the hydraulic conductivity in the Y direction that would be calculated by the HUF package.
This data set is used to display the value of the hydraulic conductivity in the Z direction between cell centers that would be calculated by the HUF package.
This data set is used to display the value of the specific storage that would be calculated by the HUF package.
This data set is used to display the value of the average specific yield for a cell that would be calculated by the HUF package.
This data set is used to display the value of the specific storage that would be calculated by the HUF package.
This data set is used to display the value of
storage coefficient for the top active cell at each row, column location)
that would be calculated by the HUF package.
When the SWT package is selected.
specific gravity of moist or unsaturated sediments
When the SWT package is selected.
When the SWT package is selected.
The offset from initial effective stress to initial preconsolidation stress at the bottom of the model layer in units of height of a column of water
When the SWT package is selected and
para.link: the user chooses to specify the initial preconsolidation stress as an offset from the initial stress

para.text: The initial preconsolidation stress, in units of height of a column of water, at the bottom of the model layer
When the SWT package is selected and
para.link: the user chooses to specify the initial preconsolidation stress directly

para.text: Values in this data set are set to true automatically in any specified head cell. It can not be manually set by the user. It is used in the formula for UZF_Layer
This data set can not be specified directly by the user or used in formulas.

para.text: This data set is used for visualization. It can not be specified directly by the user or used in formulas because it does not have a value defined in every cell.

The Active_Surface_Elevation[i] is the initial elevation of a ZETA surface in the SWI2 package.
FluidSourceDensityZone identifies the zone in the SWI2 package that is the source of sink of fluid.
Any cell with a value other than "" will be an observation cell in the SWI2 package.
process, multiple reaches can be part of a reach group. This data set is used for displaying reach group numbers.

para.text: Specifies the spatial distribution of soils.
